plugins.name: Copy Styles
plugins.description:
The Copy & Paste Styles plugin for Figma lets you seamlessly transfer styles from one file to another with just a few clicks.


Whether it’s colors, typography, effects, or grid styles, this tool allows you to quickly copy styles from any file and paste them into a new file, keeping your workflow smooth and efficient.


Ideal for designers managing multiple project and those on a free plan, this plugin saves time and ensures consistency across all your design files.
plugins.tagline: Effortless Styles Transfer Between Figma Files

104982.name: Copy Styles
104982.description:
The Copy & Paste Styles plugin for Figma lets you seamlessly transfer styles from one file to another with just a few clicks.


Whether it’s colors, typography, effects, or grid styles, this tool allows you to quickly copy styles from any file and paste them into a new file, keeping your workflow smooth and efficient.


Ideal for designers managing multiple project and those on a free plan, this plugin saves time and ensures consistency across all your design files.
104982.tagline: Effortless Styles Transfer Between Figma Files

plugins.name: Apply Colors to Selection
plugins.description:
1. (Optional) Before opening the plugin, select the element(s) who's fill color you want to use as a swatch.

2. Open the plugin and add/remove any swatches you want. Adding a new one will generate a new random color.

3. Back on the canvas, select all the elements you want and hit "Apply Colors". The selection will be filled randomly using the swatches.

The plugin doesn't automatically close so you can hit "Apply Colors" as many times as you like.

---

HINT: If you want more of one color than any others, add more swatches of that color.

4930.name: Apply Colors to Selection
4930.description:
1. (Optional) Before opening the plugin, select the element(s) who's fill color you want to use as a swatch.

2. Open the plugin and add/remove any swatches you want. Adding a new one will generate a new random color.

3. Back on the canvas, select all the elements you want and hit "Apply Colors". The selection will be filled randomly using the swatches.

The plugin doesn't automatically close so you can hit "Apply Colors" as many times as you like.

---

HINT: If you want more of one color than any others, add more swatches of that color.

plugins.name: Big Image Importer
plugins.description:
✨ Import high-resolution images into Figma & FigJam without resizing or cropping.

Frustrated with Figma scaling down your images to 4096 pixels? Tired of other plugins that split & crop your images?

This plugin allows you to import large images at their original full size without any resizing, cropping or quality loss.


🧩 Features:

  • Total privacy: Your files are processed locally on your machine and never sent to any external server.
  • No more splitting: Unlike other plugins, our solution does not split your images into smaller parts.
  • Multiple format support: Seamlessly import various image formats including JPG, JPEG & PNG.
  • Unlimited file size: Import full-resolution images without any size limitations.
  • Completely Free: Enjoy all features with no fees or hidden charges.
  • Limitless usage in Figma & FigJam.


🤗 Support and donations:

Enjoying our plugin and find it useful? Support us here


📩 Feedback and assistance:

Your feedback is important to us! For comments, inquiries or assistance, please reach out to us at support@figmats.com


💭 Contact us:

Join our community for the latest updates, practical tutorial, future announcements and daily inspiration.

Website · TikTok · Facebook · Instagram · YouTube · X (Formerly Twitter) · LinkedIn
plugins.tagline: Import big images in their original size without being resized or split into smaller parts

plugins.name: Version History → Slack
plugins.description:
A comprehensive step-by-step guide is available in the Community.


How to use Version History → Slack (VHS) ❓

  1. Run plugin;
  2. Provide the requested information: Slack Webhook URL, Figma API Token, Figma Document URL, and Document Name;
  3. Select the desired Date Format, and Date Separator;
  4. Press “Get versions”;
  5. The plugin will display the 5 most recent versions with edited title and description details (the plugin can't fetch Branch information because it is not yet accessible via the API);
  6. Click on the version you want to send to Slack;
  7. If successful, the Slack Webhook should treat the information according to the defined Workflow.


The plugin has 3 options:

  • Date Format: select your preference for date formatting;
  • Date Separator: pick a character to separate the date;
  • Keep window open: If switched on, the plugin window will remain open after sending a message. You will be able to pick another version to send to Slack.


Use Cases 🔨

  • Share Design System updates in a Slack Channel;
  • Send yourself a log of changes of an important project;
  • Inform a colleague of recent changes to a file you are working on together;
  • Keep track of different proposals;
  • Log the evolution of a project in a Google Sheet;
  • Pass the version info to Zapier;
  • Anything else you find it useful for!


In Detail 🔎

  • The Figma Plugin API no more than 30 version history states, autosaves included. Anything older than that won't be reached by the plugin;
  • The plugin will discard versions without description;
  • Due to the way Figma plugins are built, it is not possible to confirm if the message reaches Slack correctly;
  • The plugin is document agnostic, hence the need to input a Document URL;
  • You can only get versions from a file where you have Edit permissions. The plugin will report “No versions found” for any file you try to access without the right permissions.


❤ Version History → Slack? Buy me a coffee!
plugins.tagline: Send version info from your Figma documents to your custom Slack Webhook.

plugins.name: EasyMask
plugins.description:
EasyMask is a slightly more intuitive approach to masking.

When two shapes are selected, Figma chooses the bottom shape to be the mask. This does the opposite. EasyMask will create a mask from the top selected layer.

2161.name: EasyMask
2161.description:

plugins.name: ToolTips
plugins.description:
Description:

Welcome to ToolTips – your simple yet powerful assistant in Figma! Designing just got easier. Pick any layer in your Figma project and voilà! You can craft custom tooltips in a snap, right within your design canvas.


What ToolTips Does:


  1. Easy Tooltip Magic: Select a layer, and ToolTips helps you quickly whip up those nifty little bits of info that users love – all manually creating each layer.
  2. Your Style, Your Rules: Personalize your tooltips with colors, text, and directions. Make them look and feel just right for your design.
  3. Coming Soon - Interactive Fun: Get ready for more! I am cooking up interactive tricks—like hover actions—to make your tooltips even more engaging (coming soon!) and design system support.


Why ToolTips?

ToolTips is all about making your designs more user-friendly. It's your secret weapon for adding those little nuggets of info that speak volumes. Stay tuned for more features and keep delighting your users with ToolTips in Figma!
plugins.tagline: Tooltips made easy!

plugins.name: Format Currency
plugins.description:
Format and convert between currencies.


Format Currency

Changes the format and/or locale of currencies in text layers within the selection or on the current page.

  • Optionally change to Explicit format (eg. $42.00 → $42.00 USD) or Short format (eg. 37,00 € EUR → 37,00 €).


Convert Currency

Converts currencies in text layers within the selection or on the current page.

  • Optionally round the converted currencies to the nearest 100s and 1000s.


Reset Plugin

Resets all settings to their defaults.

37278.description:

plugins.name: Pages
plugins.description:
Organize pages with groups and emoji in your design file with ease!


Core:

  • Group pages
  • Add divider for group
  • Reorder, rename, delete page/group
  • Add emoji for page/group


Add-on:

  • Dark mode
  • Navigate to page in Quick Actions
  • Customize divider
  • Spread group into pages/Turn page into group
  • Search emoji, skin tone support


Limitation:

  • Currently, reordering pages without opening plugin works only when the the group (divider) position doesn't change.


Feedback:

Leave a comment or email for feedback and support, thanks in advance!
plugins.tagline: Organize pages with groups and emoji in your design file!

plugins.name: Style Guide Generator - Pixelyo
plugins.description:
Style Guide Generator is designed to simplify the creation of a comprehensive style guide for design projects in Figma. It allows you to generate a complete style guide that includes typography, color schemes, and effects in a structured and easy-to-use manner.


Key Features of the Plugin:


Design Type Selection:

You can select the type of design you are working on, either for web or mobile applications. This allows you to customize options based on project requirements.


Font Selection:

Includes a list of ready-made fonts for selection, with an additional option for manually entering a custom font if the desired one is not available.


Primary and Accent Colors:

Defines the main colors, such as brand colors, accent colors, neutral colors, and specific colors for error, warning, and success states.

Users can easily view and edit these colors through a user-friendly interface with both a color picker and a manual hex input.


Point System Control:

Choose a point system (e.g., 4-Point Grid) to set the sizing system, helping in organizing and structuring the user interface more efficiently.


Customization Based on Design Type:

If the design is for a web project & Mobile, additional options like base font size and font scale ratio are available. These options help in setting consistent typography across the interface.

Interactive Style Guide Generation:


Once the desired properties are selected, you can press the "Generate Style Guide" button to create the style guide instantly.


Intended Use:

This plugin is particularly useful for designers who want to create a consistent style guide quickly and easily. It helps you compile all design properties, such as text styles, colors, and layout configurations in one place, making it easier to document your work and maintain consistency across the project.


If you need any adjustments or further details, feel free to let me know!
plugins.tagline: create style guide in seconds

networkAccess.reasoning: Required for loading React and color picker libraries

123021.release_notes:
## Typography System
- Added typography variables binding to text elements
- Improved font weight handling in collections
- Enhanced font family fallback system
- Added automatic style mapping for typography scales

## Color System
- Added shadow colors to local variables
- Improved color scale generation
- Enhanced dark mode color adaptation
- Added color opacity variables
- Implemented semantic color naming system

## Spacing System
- Improved spacing variables structure
- Added responsive spacing scales
- Enhanced spacing validation system
- Implemented consistent spacing tokens

## Shadow System
- Added shadow color variables
- Improved shadow elevation scales
- Enhanced shadow color adaptation for themes
- Added semantic shadow naming system

## Local Variables
- Improved color variable organization
- Enhanced spacing variable structure
- Added better variable naming conventions
- Implemented variable validation system
- Added variable documentation support

## General Improvements
- Enhanced error handling
- Improved performance for large design systems
- Added better type safety
- Enhanced documentation

plugins.name: DSGN Notes
plugins.description:
Let your thoughts take flight. Jot it down.


Designs can sometimes require a bit of clarity, and you want your design hand-offs to feel effortless. That's how note-taking and marking up documents should feel — effortless, quick, and simple.


Design notes is a minimalist plugin that quickly gets the job done. Discover a space to capture your design thought process.


Features:

  1. Rich text editing
  2. Label your notes for design use cases
  3. Place markers for precision
  4. Customize your note colours
  5. Express yourself with emojis
  6. Light and Dark theme to match your preference
  7. Native Figma look and feel
plugins.tagline: Add Clarity to your flows ✍️

plugins.name: Dark Matter
plugins.description:
Quickly switch between light and dark canvas. 


Usage:

  1. Install ‘Dark Matter’ Plugin.
  2. Run the plugin once.
  3. When no frame is selected, the plugin will appear in the Properties Panel (Design).
  4. Switch between light (#E5E5E5) and dark (#1E1E1E) canvas by clicking the button. 


The best part - there’s no need to rerun the plugin. Once run, it’s available on all your pages for that particular file.


I also made a website for the plugin, check it out? You'll like it.


If you use this and find it helpful, I’d love to hear from you. I’m @dakshiblue on Twitter. Or support me here.


Lastly, if you come across a bug or if you have any ideas, share that too.


Enjoy!❤️
plugins.tagline: Quickly switch between light and dark canvas

32776.name: Dark Matter
32776.description:
Quickly switch between light and dark canvas. 


Usage:

  1. Install ‘Dark Matter’ Plugin.
  2. Run the plugin once.
  3. When no frame is selected, the plugin will appear in the Properties Panel (Design).
  4. Switch between light (#E5E5E5) and dark (#1E1E1E) canvas by clicking the button. 


The best part - there’s no need to rerun the plugin. Once run, it’s available on all your pages for that particular file.


I also made a website for the plugin, check it out? You'll like it.


If you use this and find it helpful, I’d love to hear from you. I’m @dakshiblue on Twitter. Or support me here.


Lastly, if you come across a bug or if you have any ideas, share that too.


Enjoy!❤️
32776.tagline: Quickly switch between light and dark canvas

plugins.name: OKLCH Color Variations
plugins.description:
The Ultimate Color Palette Generator. Use this Plugin to generate Color Palettes with Variations. The shades can vary across Lightness (How Bright the color is. 0-1), Chroma(How colorful the color is 0-0.37), and Hue (The kind of color. 0deg-360deg). The ability to control these individual parameters makes it perfect for building palettes to be used in interface design, because you can use these parameters to establish hierarchy, contrast, attention, etc.


Use Mathematical Relations to build your perfect Palette.


You can use mathematical relations to build your perfect palette. For each of the 3 parameters (L, C, H), you can use a Mathematical relation to decide how each shade of the palette vary from each other or relate to each other.


An common example of how the equations can be used is: Using a Linear or Arctan function for Lightness, and using a Normal Distribution for Chroma, and using a Flat Linear Curve for Hue. You could also use a subtle Arctan function for Hue to create interesting Palettes. The possibilities are endless. Keep experimenting!


Why OKLCH over HSL?


Even HSL allows you to think of colors as these individual parameters, but HSL is not perfect. Different Hues with same Luminescence, and Saturation values can produce colors with different contrast levels (for example, yellow and blue). This makes it hard to consistently produce accessible color palettes for Interface Design. OKLCH color space solves this because it's modelled to be close to human perception of color.


Your Support Means the World!


This plugin is completely free and crafted with care. If it has added value to your work, please consider Donating on GitHub. Your support helps me dedicate time to improving and maintaining this tool, ensuring it stays free and accessible for everyone. Thank you for being a part of this journey!


Donate on GitHub
plugins.tagline: Accessible Color Palettes in OKLCH Color Space.

plugins.name: Dither it!
plugins.description:
Dither it! is a plugin that let’s you dither images in Figma. Dithering is a process of reducing the number of colors in an image while retaining detail. Think old computer graphics or risograph printing.


Features include:


  1. Two unique dither styles: Bayer (ordered) dithering and Error Diffusion dithering with over 10 algorithm options
  2. Palette presets
  3. Custom palette creation, including access to your documents Local Color Styles
  4. ✨ Automatic palette generation that pulls colors from your image
plugins.tagline: An image dithering tool

105991.name: Dither it!
105991.description:
Dither it! is a plugin that let’s you dither images in Figma. Dithering is a process of reducing the number of colors in an image while retaining detail. Think old computer graphics or risograph printing.


Features include:


  1. Two unique dither styles: Bayer (ordered) dithering and Error Diffusion dithering with over 10 algorithm options
  2. Palette presets
  3. Custom palette creation, including access to your documents Local Color Styles
  4. ✨ Automatic palette generation that pulls colors from your image
105991.release_notes: Clean up about text and add usage indicator

plugins.name: JSON Populate
plugins.description:
Use your own real JSON data to populate your text layers. No longer fill your designs with lorem ipsum or irrelevant names, objects, places and more.

How to use: 
1. Write your JSON as one big object containing arrays with a key as name. Example can be seen in the screenshot or on the git repo. 
2. Enter the url in the plugin and press save
3. Select one or more text layers and press one of the buttons generated based on your JSON to replace the text layer(s).

Extra:
Host your JSON on some repo so it's easily maintanable. You could also use a free service such as 'myjson.com'. Your URL should be saved on this instance of Figma. However keep a backup of the url just in case you switch to a different computer or between browser/desktop often. 

Roadmap:
- Better error handling
- Support more JSON structures
- Use local JSON/paste JSON

plugins.name: Font Suggestion
plugins.description:
Introducing a revolutionary plugin for Figma designers - a powerful tool that harnesses the power of ChatGPT API to suggest the perfect font for your designs!

With this plugin, designers no longer have to spend countless hours scrolling through endless font options, trying to find the perfect match for their designs. Instead, simply input your design requirements and let ChatGPT's advanced language model do the work for you.


This plugin's intuitive interface seamlessly integrates with Figma's design environment, providing you with real-time suggestions for the ideal font based on your design specifications. Say goodbye to the frustration of trial and error, and say hello to faster, more efficient font selection.


Whether you're designing a new logo, creating a website or developing a brand identity, this plugin is an essential addition to your toolkit. Say goodbye to the guesswork and let ChatGPT's AI-powered font suggestions take your designs to the next level. Try it today and experience the power of AI-assisted design.
plugins.tagline: Font Suggestion powered by ChatGPT as your design mentor.

With this plugin, designers no longer have to spend countless hours scrolling through endless font options, trying to find the perfect match for their designs. Instead, simply input your design requirements and let ChatGPT's advanced language model do the work for you.


This plugin's intuitive interface seamlessly integrates with Figma's design environment, providing you with real-time suggestions for the ideal font based on your design specifications. Say goodbye to the frustration of trial and error, and say hello to faster, more efficient font selection.


Whether you're designing a new logo, creating a website or developing a brand identity, this plugin is an essential addition to your toolkit. Say goodbye to the guesswork and let ChatGPT's AI-powered font suggestions take your designs to the next level. Try it today and experience the power of AI-assisted design.

plugins.name: Frame Overlay
plugins.description:
Create custom overlays for any frame


  1. Quickly create overlays filling the entire frame
  2. Use any fill and set custom opacities
  3. Save custom overlay fills, including library styles, gradients, and images. To do that, select a layer with the fill you want to save and run the command “Save overlay fill”
  4. Remove custom overlay fills using the “Remove overlay fill” command


  1. Automatically updates the fill of an existing overlay layer (named “Overlay”) when the plugin is run again
  2. The overlay will be placed below layers like popovers, alerts, context menus, notifications, and more


Notes


  1. The overlay will be placed below the first layer on the first level of the selected frame that has one of the following terms in its name: Alert, App Clip, Context Menu, Contextual Menu, Dynamic Island, Face ID, Keyboard, Modal, Notification, Popover, Sheet, Status Bar, and Touch ID
  2. In frames with Auto Layout, the overlay will be positioned absolutely


Roadmap


  1. Overlay fill previews in the quick actions bar
  2. Ability to enter colour codes directly
  3. Ability to save and apply custom effects to overlays


Do you have a feature request? Let me know on GitHub or Mastodon :)


This plugin is open source on GitHub


Made by @johjakob
plugins.tagline: Create custom overlays for any frame

plugins.name: html-to-figma-auto-layout DEV-plugin
plugins.description:
Converts HTML to Figma, with autoLayout Support


Integration steps

To integrate Auto Layout into your project, follow these steps:


1. Identify Auto Layout Elements

Determine which HTML elements should use Auto Layout. Add the data-auto-layout="true" attribute to these elements.


<div data-auto-layout="true">
  <!-- Your Auto Layout content goes here -->
</div>
plugins.tagline: html-to-figma-auto-layout DEV-plugin

plugins.name: Arrange hues
plugins.description:
Arrange color hues on a hue ramp and see which hues are used a lot and where there are gaps. Originally created to compare competitor brand colors and discover opportunities.


How to use:

  1. Select layers of colors you want to arrange.
  2. Run the plugin.


Limitations:

  • Can't select more than 50 layers. You will have to split it into two runs if you have more colors to arrange.
  • Works only with rectangles, ellipses, polygons, stars and vectors.
  • Won't work on layers with gradients or multiple fills in it.
  • If a selection has some non-compatible layer types, the plugin will just ignore those layers and still arrange the compatible ones.


Future release ideas:

  • Arrange colors based on saturation levels too.
  • Probably a UI to control the size of the swatches.
  • Show count of color swatches with same hue value (it's overlapped in the current version).


---

Credits:

Used Marco Demaio's rgb2hsb function to get hue values from Figma object RGB values.


Got more ideas or doubts?

Connect with me on twitter.com/anveshdunna

plugins.name: Layermate | Create designs with AI chat
plugins.description:
Layermate is an AI-powered design assistant that helps you create designs directly in Figma through natural conversations. Simply describe what you need, and Layermate will generate designs.


Website


https://www.layermate.ai


Features


Generate UI Through Conversations: Describe your UI needs in natural language and get instant designs generated directly through AI conversations. Try example prompts like 'Design a sign-up form'.


Share Context for Better Results: Attach screenshots, PDFs, or selected Figma layers to your conversations to provide context and get more relevant design suggestions.


Pricing


Free Plan: 5 messages/day

Pro Plan: $20/month — includes 1,000,000 tokens

Token Pack for Pro Users: $10 for 500,000 tokens (valid for 2 months)

accepted.name: Rera
accepted.description: Design × AI: Shaping Tomorrow's Creative Tools

plugins.tagline: Generate designs through natural conversations. Bring your ideas to life faster than ever.

plugins.name: Figma Color Manager
plugins.description:
A plugin to sync the colors from the codebase and the design files, the easy way!


In Figma, colors are handled as styles and there is no way to ensure these variable are consistent between the code and the design files.

Figma Color Manager solves this by acting as an interface between your Figma styles and your codebase.

You'll always have the same colors with the same name, on both sides.


Recommended Workflow

  • Use a single CSS file that holds the colors, it'll be easier to update it regularly
  • Whenever changes are made in figma, export your colors and copy them in your code.
  • Use the import feature if your colors come from your codebase
  • If your color styles have a description, store your colors as JSON or JS and build it using json-to-css-variables
  • If you don't care about color descriptions, you can just export to CSS


Other usages

  • As a developer, you started a project using HTML and CSS and now want to design it in Figma. You can copy your colors CSS variables and import them in your new Figma project.
  • As a designer, you delivering a design to development. You can export the colors, and give it to them. It'll ensure they use the right colors and they'll have the same names, avoiding confusion.
  • You want to use only colors from another Figma project. Using it as a library would overload your components and text styles. Just export the colors and import them in your other project.

Next Features

  • SCSS support for import and export
  • Figma colors can have spaces in them, in the code they can't. For now we camelCase it in JS/JSON and kebab-case it for CSS. I plan on making this configurable.

About Me

I am Tom Quinonero, a developer that always works close to the design team. I bring back together coders and UI teams by making tools and process that improve collaboration. If you need my help on a project, send me an email!

accepted.name: Tom Quinonero
accepted.description:
I create resources and plugins for Figma. 
Follow me on twitter for more!

  • Use the import feature if your colors come from your codebase
  • If your color styles have a description, store your colors as JSON or JS and build it using json-to-css-variables
  • If you don't care about color descriptions, you can just export to CSS

  • As a designer, you delivering a design to development. You can export the colors, and give it to them. It'll ensure they use the right colors and they'll have the same names, avoiding confusion.

About Me

plugins.name: RPG Awesome Icons Set by Iconduck
plugins.description:
This Figma Plugin powers the RPG Awesome Icons Set open source library. It’s an icon library designed for mobile, desktop, web and print.


There are 495 icons included in this icon library, all of which can be searched through and added to your designs.


Popular RPG Awesome Icons Set icons:

  • Crown icons
  • Video game icons
  • Video game graphics
  • Board game icons
  • Gaming icons


Plugin features:

  • Drag and drop any icons
  • Search through them instantly
  • Click any icon to add it your design
  • View search history
  • View embed history


Coming soon:

  • Save your favorite RPG Awesome Icons Set icons

plugins.name: Ultimate Exporter
plugins.description:
Easily export your assets and frames directly into your favorite tools like Google Drive, Dropbox, Microsoft OneDrive etc. Currently, we are only supporting Google Drive but we are actively working to get other tools.


You don’t need to download your exported selection to put them into your team collaboration tools like Google Drive. You can easily do that using this plugin.


All your main frames can be directly uploaded to the selected folder of your Google Drive.


If you are looking to export only a few frames, you need to select them into Figma Export and then plugin will take care of the other things

plugins.name: Icon Recolor Helper
plugins.description:
Easy Color Control for Icons in Design System


Working with icons in Figma just got a whole lot easier and more flexible with Icon Recolor. This innovative plugin is here to revolutionize your workflow by offering a unique solution for merging all layers in your icons. With IconMerge, you gain full control over the color of your icons, allowing you to effortlessly adapt them to any design or theme.


Key Features:


Layer Merging: Icon Recolor automatically merges all layers of your icons into a single graphic element. This simplifies the editing process and allows you to change the color of an icon with just one action, without worrying about the complexity of its internal structure.


Universal Color Management: Thanks to its deep integration with Figma, Icon Recolor lets you instantly update the colors of icons across any project. It's the perfect solution for brands and teams aiming to maintain visual consistency.


Ease of Use: Icon Recolor is designed with user convenience in mind. Its simple and intuitive interface makes it easy to master, allowing you to focus on creativity rather than complex processes.


Use Icon Recolor to make your icon colors consistent and control them from anywhere in your projects, ensuring your designs are always on brand and on point.
plugins.tagline: Set icons color  for Design System

plugins.name: CSS Variables Generator
plugins.description:
Elevate the design-to-development workflow by instantly converting Figma variables and styles into CSS custom properties.


How to use

  1. Explore the pre-generated CSS output, tailored to your selected categories.
  2. Review the console feedback to ensure everything is in order.
  3. When you're ready, copy or download the content.


Key features

  1. Syntax highlighting: Allows seamless code review.
  2. Style names processing: Ensures valid CSS property names.
  3. Relative length units: Pixel values are provided alongside their rem equivalents.
  4. Real-time collaboration: Updates in real time, no need for re-runs.
  5. Console: Errors and exceptions are handled by the plugin and reported to the user.
  6. Light and dark themes supported.


Variables

  1. The content structure is based on local collections.
  2. If a given collection has more than one mode, the mode name is included as a suffix in the following format --{name}-{mode}.
  3. If a value is aliased to another variable, it includes the root variable name, not the value itself. For example: --my-variable: var(--my-alias).
  4. All variable types are supported.


Styles

  1. Type: Includes font family, size, weight, style, letter spacing, and line height.
  2. Colors: Displayed in hex format or rgba() notation.
  3. Gradients: Individual {name}-stop-n rules for seamless integration. This includes both color and position along the gradient's axis.
  4. Shadows: Allows drop and inner shadows, including support for composite styles.
  5. Grids: Includes size (when applicable), column/row count, and gutter size.


Feedback Welcome

Feel free to share your feedback and ideas to enhance the plugin's functionality.
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma variables and styles to CSS

117432.name: CSS Variables Generator
117432.description:
Elevate the design-to-development workflow by instantly converting Figma variables and styles into CSS custom properties.


How to use

  1. Explore the pre-generated CSS output, tailored to your selected categories.
  2. Review the console feedback to ensure everything is in order.
  3. When you're ready, copy or download the content.


Key features

  1. Syntax highlighting: Allows seamless code review.
  2. Style names processing: Ensures valid CSS property names.
  3. Relative length units: Pixel values are provided alongside their rem equivalents.
  4. Real-time collaboration: Updates in real time, no need for re-runs.
  5. Console: Errors and exceptions are handled by the plugin and reported to the user.
  6. Light and dark themes supported.


Variables

  1. The content structure is based on local collections.
  2. If a given collection has more than one mode, the mode name is included as a suffix in the following format --{name}-{mode}.
  3. If a value is aliased to another variable, it includes the root variable name, not the value itself. For example: --my-variable: var(--my-alias).
  4. All variable types are supported.


Styles

  1. Type: Includes font family, size, weight, style, letter spacing, and line height.
  2. Colors: Displayed in hex format or rgba() notation.
  3. Gradients: Individual {name}-stop-n rules for seamless integration. This includes both color and position along the gradient's axis.
  4. Shadows: Allows drop and inner shadows, including support for composite styles.
  5. Grids: Includes size (when applicable), column/row count, and gutter size.


Feedback Welcome

Feel free to share your feedback and ideas to enhance the plugin's functionality.
117432.tagline: Transform Figma variables and styles to CSS

plugins.name: Place››holder
plugins.description:
Generate simple and effortless placeholder content for your mockups and prototypes.


Currently Place››holder allows you to generate random UK-styled addresses, names, UK-styled phone numbers and email addresses.


Simply click any of the generate buttons to create a new placeholder text node, or, select an existing text node and hit generate to replace its content, with your existing font.


A super lightweight and simple plugin. Built because I need it, shared because I'm hopeful it's useful to others.


These plugins are free to use, but if you fancy buying me a coffee because it's been useful to you, I'd be grateful: https://ko-fi.com/kemiljk

accepted.name: Karl Koch
accepted.description: Currently building DuckDuckGo, Cosmic, Hand››over, and plugins.run.

plugins.name: CodeTea - Image to Figma, ScreenShot to Figma
plugins.description:
✨ Convert Images to Figma Designs – Instantly & Accurately

Turn static screenshots into responsive, editable Figma layouts in seconds!


🖼️ Convert from Image to Figma

Upload any image — whether it’s a web layout, mobile app, or a hand-drawn wireframe — and get a fully editable design in Figma.

✅ Supports PNG, JPG, WebP formats

✅ Works even with UI screenshots or sketches


📸 Convert from Screenshot to Figma

Just take a screenshot of a website or app, upload it, and voilà — your design is ready to tweak in Figma!

🪄 Save hours of manual work

⚡ Great for redesigns and mockups


🎨 Easy to Design

No need to start from scratch. Use the converted layout as a starting point:

💡 Drag, drop, tweak — all elements are editable

📐 Maintain spacing, fonts, and colors


🎯 Accuracy

Our AI-powered engine delivers exceptional precision:

✅ Clean, organized layers

✅ Fonts, colors, and structure retained

✅ Almost pixel-perfect output


📱 Responsive Layouts

Get designs that work across devices:

🔁 Auto-layout ready

📏 Fluid grid conversion

🧩 Ideal for mobile, tablet, and desktop design systems


🚀 Why you'll love it:

  1. Super fast turnaround
  2. Boost your design workflow
  3. Ideal for developers, designers, and non-tech teams


🌟 Try it today and turn any image into a Figma masterpiece in seconds!
plugins.tagline: Covert from images, screenshots to figma design

plugins.name: Component Description Manager
plugins.description:
Manage description of all your components in one place!


Each main component (and its variants) can have a description that might be useful for you, other designers and developers. Descriptions can provide tips for using particular component, important dev notes or act as tags for better searching (of icons, for instance).


Without this plugin, you can add a description by selecting the component and opening Component configuration modal from the Design panel. It might quickly become not effective if you want to use it for your entire library.


With this plugin, you can preview and edit descriptions for all components and their variants from a single view.


It works with native Figma feature – it does not store descriptions in any plugin metadata.


To make this experience smooth plugin has a lot of convenient features:

  1. Grouping components by page
  2. Component names that act as a jump-links
  3. Option to turn on/off the visibility of variants
  4. Option to auto-select component upon focusing description field (it helps find proper component with ease)
  5. Option to auto-focus description field upon selecting component on the canvas


Try it out with a playground file to see it in action!
plugins.tagline: Manage descriptions of all your components in one place

plugins.name: Circum Icons by Iconduck
plugins.description:
This Figma Plugin powers the Circum Icons open source library. It’s an icon library designed for mobile, desktop, web and print.


There are 285 icons included in this icon library, all of which can be searched through and added to your designs.


Popular Circum Icons icons:

  • Sports and fitness icons
  • Interface icons
  • App icons
  • Transportation icons


Plugin features:

  • Drag and drop any icons
  • Search through them instantly
  • Click any icon to add it your design
  • View search history
  • View embed history


Coming soon:

  • Save your favorite Circum Icons icons

accepted.name: Iconduck
accepted.description: 275,000+ open source icons, illustrations, emojis, logos, flags, clipart and graphics. Free to use on personal and commercial projects.

plugins.tagline: Circum Icons is an open source library of 285 icons. Free to use in all your designs!

plugins.name: Icon Zone
plugins.description:
Icon Zone helps create a square slice around your icons what is perfect center of the vectors or the group you selected. At the same times the slice will be ready to export as SVGs .

🤔 How to use?

- Select the vectors what is belong to the one icon and trigger the IconZone.
- Or select the group what contain the vectors and trigger the IconZone.

plugins.name: Auto Layout Sorter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you sort child layers of an Auto Layout frame based on their common text layer names. It's an ideal plugin if you work a lot with tables or long lists of components and you don't want to spend time and manual labour to sort each layer by hand. With this plugin you can sort your layers with just a few clicks


**How it works**

1. Select an Auto Layout frame and make sure it has child layers with corresponding text layer names

2. The plugin will check what text values can be sorted and displays this in the plugin interface.

3. Choose the type of text value you want to sort

4. Choose ascending or descending

5. And lastly → hit the 'Sort' button


Your list view has been sorted!


Like using this plugin? Support me via PayPal or Ko-fi ✌️
plugins.tagline: Sort layers of Auto Layout frames based on their equal text values.
